intro: Wahlenbergia pygmaea subsp. tararua, commonly known as the Tararua dwarf forget-me-not, is a small flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine areas, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer months. This subspecies is often found in rocky or scree environments, where it forms dense mats.
